website_summaries.verdict: This balance bike lets smaller toddlers and preschoolers keep up with older siblings and cousins.
pros: Teaches kids balance in a few weeks
Seat and handlebar heights adjust to accommodate ages 18 months to three years, or a 12-inch to 17-inch inseam
Built-in footrests are perfect for learning to balance and glide
cons: Foam tires won't go flat but lack the traction of rubber

customer_reviews.title: We dig this lil bike!!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research before purchase and I'm my opinion.. this is the balance bike to get! Tires were a big issue on all the reviews.. this one does have the harder foam looking tires.. I was honestly concerned.. but took a chance.. the other one kinda comparable..."banana" I think.. had hard shiny plastic tires and tire reviews were terrible... slick on grass and gravel.. and the handle bars seemed oddly angled.. These tires on the strider bike are fine! And the handle bars look great .. And it was perfect height for our 18 month old who is not on the tall end of the spectrum, lol. We dig this bike! Glad we bought it!! Vroom vroom :)
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great learning aid
customer_reviews.text: Strider bikes are great! My daughter struggled and struggled to transition from training wheels to a 2 wheeler. Literally months of trying and crashing... One day one of her friends dads stopped by and dropped off their strider. In 2 days our daughter switched to her 2 wheeler and was riding great! That same strider bike got passed around to about a dozen of their friends and taught them all to ride in a couple days to 2 weeks. They are pretty expensive for something you don’t really need very long so get together with a group and get one to pass around. Once they can ride there is no reason to keep them on it.
customer_reviews.author: Not Assigned

customer_reviews.title: Perfect introduction to bicycling!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE bike to start little people on! No training wheels, just easy balancing. We started both our grandchildren on Striders when they turned 2. The oldest made a 5-minute transition to a regular pedal bike (without training wheels) at age 3 1/2. The youngest is just 2 1/2, but is comfortable and flies along on his Strider. The Strider is adjustable for height and light enough for a 2-year-old to pick up when it tips. We love how quickly this brings our littlest family members into biking.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Redbird

customer_reviews.title: Easy riding!
customer_reviews.text: Best way to teach a kid to ride! Just the thought of teaching my son to ride a bike made me anxious, but this Strider lets him go as fast or as slow as he likes and he's in love! He rides it everywhere, even in the grocery store. There's a BMX track near us so we entered a few races. It's super cute watching the little ones stride along. He's confident when riding and no stress for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Buy this already!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike in red for my 18 month old boy. He is now 3.5 and went straight to a big boy bike-no training wheels needed! And now his 18 month old little brother is on the strider.. best purchase ever! Worth every penny! Side note: this bike is super light-easy for an 18 month old to maneuver around and light enough for me to carry it home when the kids get tired of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Dashelle Holliday

customer_reviews.title: stiff turning
customer_reviews.text: We kept thinking this problem would resolve itself. the handlebars are super tight no matter what we do.... We waited too long to return this bike but just be aware it could be this way. I have seen many that are just fine.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great, light weight balance bike.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. It's light enough that when my toddler would get tired I could pick it and carry him, his baby brother (in a baby carrier) and the bike home. We bought it for his second birthday, he couldn't ride more than a few minutes the first couple months, I think attention span was a factor. Before his third birthday he was riding two miles on a regular basis. People stop me to ask about the bike all the time. I recently bought a different brand of pedal bike to transition him to, but it's so much heavier. I wish I had bought the 14in strider with pedal option.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best way for kids to learn to ride a bike!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 2.5 year old instead of a bike with training wheels. I’m so glad we did! It’s amazing how quick he can get going and I can see his confidence growing each time he rides it. I feel like it gives him the necessary skills to be able to ride a bike with pedals (like balance and steering) so he can concentrate on pedaling when that time comes, as opposed to worrying about if someone is holding on to the bike, pedaling, learning to balance and steer all in one go. I’m a huge fan!!
customer_reviews.author: LBron

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons second birthday, I will be returning it after a replacement arrives, but two things are off with the one I got. First, the handlebars are really tight, I think my unit has a fit clearance that is too tight, and my son can't turn the handle. I can hold the handle bars and the weight of the bike suspended in mid air can barely can turn the handlebars. Second, while functional it is still fine, my rear wheel is not straight, not even close, not sure how it got past quality control.
customer_reviews.author: GregN

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built balance bike. I purchased for my daughter when she was about 18 months old and I hoped that she would pick it up quickly. Well, sadly, she has not used it once...she's terrified of it. She's two now and I'll probably pull it out again soon to see if she'll give it another try. That being said, it's still a great little bike for a beginner. It's of good quality, perfect size for the very young toddlers, and the adjustable seat and handbars are perfect for the growing child. I really wish my daughter would use this! When purchasing, don't forget to order a helmet as well!
customer_reviews.author: J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: To hard to steer
customer_reviews.text: We want to love this but it is to hard to steer. It takes a lot of effort from an adult to turn the handles, my 2 year old can't do it at all. I read sometimes the bikes come with replacement bushing to fix the problem but ours didn't. I found one place that sells online but they only ship to Canada. This was an expensive bike, it should work right for the price I paid. I shouldn't have to be trying to find replacement parts. I feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Wood

customer_reviews.title: Defective piece
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this but the #5 piece literally won’t even fit on, it’s too small. We can’t finish assembling it which is extremely frustrating when you have an excited toddler wanting to ride with their brother. Hopefully they have great customer service or I won’t be recommending this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Freeborn

customer_reviews.title: Best Balance Bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this balance bike. This was my daughters 2nd birthday present. She loves it. She still isn’t full go but she rides it frequently and gets better every time. I like the idea of learning balance without the false support of training wheels. This bike is easy assemble and is very light. I’m very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Ard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my 2 year old and he loves it. He is still getting the hang of it, but it’s sturdy and a really good fit for him from seat to handle bars. He’s in the 70% for height so a bit taller than kids his age. My first son was in the 15% for height and definitely would not be able to use this bike at age two. It was easy to put together and all the pieces came in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: amcayanan

customer_reviews.title: Kid's favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo loves this bike. He doesn know how to ride it just quite yet but I have high Hopes. It was received with scratches on handle part but I figured, it would get scratches later any way so I let it slide. We purchased helmet and other safety wears separately but it could have been better if they had like bundles.
customer_reviews.author: Summerdino

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy for my two year old
customer_reviews.text: Oh I was so excited for this bike. I bought it for my sons second birthday. He was so happy when he saw it. First time he got on it he fell, which was expected. The problem was that the bike was too heavy for him to pick up. Now he hates it. He won’t even get back on it. I read the reviews and knew this could be a problem but I still bought it. So now it is just sitting here collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Megan balongue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike for kids to learn balance on
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike for kids to learn balance on! No pedals to get in the way. My son was riding it in no time flat and he was 2 at the time. This bike is well constructed and made. We will be able to pass it down to another child. Tires are solid not air filled which is nice to have on this type of bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ronwasright

customer_reviews.title: Would not assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed in this. Like many of the the one star review it wouldn’t assemble as part 5 wouldn’t fit!! I had to send it back and order a new one (whereby part 5 does fit). Surely they would have better quality control! I needed to explain to a 2 year old why he couldn’t have his bike and needed to send it back ... thank you Strider!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Slowey

customer_reviews.title: Good first bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for my son because it was the model with the lowest seat height I could find, we upgraded later to a kokua bicycle. If you want to do your back a favor, get one of these bikes, it will save you a lot of pushing later on when they try riding a bike with pedals
customer_reviews.author: Stefaan VD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Starter Bike
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old wanted desperately to ride a bike like her older brother. She was born with achondroplasia (she will be a little person). There is no bike that would work for her except for this balance bike. It is a perfect size for her little body and now she pushes herself up and down the sidewalk "just like her older brother" on his bike. Thank you Strider for offering a product like this that will help all children.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my son for his third birthday. Initially he didn't show much interest in riding it for more than a few minutes. However, as he got older he became more confident on it and rides it for longer periods of time. He is almost 4 now and is doing great. He already picks his feet up and glides across the driveway. You can't go wrong with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Chapman

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old gets around great on this bike. His two older brothers ride "big boy" bikes but with the Strider he can keep up with them and feel like a big boy too. He has progressively gotten better at coasting and I can tell it's teaching him to balance! He prefers this bike over his electric motorcycle even. It's the best purchase I've ever made for him as far as toys go, he's really enjoyed it and uses it daily.
customer_reviews.author: fletch0587

customer_reviews.title: Not 12” wheels
customer_reviews.text: So from the bike being named classic 12 you would assume it has 12” wheels. It does not, they are 10.5” and was too short for my child who had a different balance bike with exactly 12” wheels which was good for him. Very misleading advertisement. The extra 1.5” does make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even easier to assemble than older generation.
customer_reviews.text: Our second "classis" strider over the past 8+ years. Extremely durable. Notable improvements over the last 8 years was even easier assembly. One notable area where the product is different and noticed by my 3 year-old daughter was the seat. The new seat is all plastic will no padding. It's more durable but it is not as comfortable as the older generation model as per my 3 year-old. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: SirSpendsAlot

customer_reviews.title: No pedals so grand daughter won’t ride it.
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter was not thrilled that the bicycle did not come with pedals. I have tried to get her interested in the bicycle but since the other kids have pedals on their bicycles, she won’t use this bicycle. I think it’s a good idea but just not for her. Also the seat falls down and will not tighten well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lane

customer_reviews.title: We love strider bikes my oldest son has the strider sport ...
customer_reviews.text: We love strider bikes my oldest son has the strider sport version. So we decided to buy my youngest a bike to, only this time we bought the classic model and I have to say I am fairly disappointed because the handle bars are extremely hard to turn. The neck bushing were made way to tight and the allowed tolerances were off on the product! I would like strider to contact me for a replacement part!!!
customer_reviews.author: Plove

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great 1st bike! I was amazed at how quick my 2 year old picked up on how to use it. She loves riding around our yard and driveway. Within a few months she was trying to lift her feet up and get her balance! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a 1st bike! The seat is adjustable for very young kids (18 months-ish) and does require a tool to loosen and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Burton

customer_reviews.title: We've bought two!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Strider bike we've purchased. We thought we could get away with getting our second child a cheaper version- no go the thing stunk. I had to send back and have a strider overnight shipped! The bike is light and easily maneuvered by our average sized 2 year old. It provides a great learning to balance experience. Our older son learned balance so quickly and easily with this bike. Not to mention his has been left outside for going on three years and while faded is still in great condition. We love these bikes and recommend them to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: ... twin boy and girl they are 3 they just love them. We ordered one for 20 month old ...
customer_reviews.text: We have two others for our twin boy and girl they are 3 they just love them. We ordered one for 20 month old for Christmas when putting the handlebars in the black piece was missing it’s the part that holds the bar tight You flip it open then flip it closed to keep the handle bar tight could you send that black piece that is missing on her green strider thank you John Mansfield
customer_reviews.author: john mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Good 1st time bike
customer_reviews.text: -1star because the seat is hard as a rock. But my son loves the bike. Very easy to walk with or ride on. Everything stays in place and he tries dont ever need air. Wish these bikes came with a kick stand
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Handlebar clamp did not fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike from Amazon a few weeks ago and I'm currently assembling it for my daughter's birthday in a few days. The clamp which holds the handlebars tight is too small. It doesn't slide down over the post at all, even having tried pliers to narrow the post, and a mallet. It is currently unusable. I also submitted a question on the Strider website asking for a replacement clamp, and I'll update this review if I hear from them in either forum.
customer_reviews.author: Halle

customer_reviews.title: First Bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is extremely easy to put together. It's very sturdy, very light weight, well built and is a good quality. However, for the price point I think the company could make some changes. First, the seat is a hard plastic and my boy has been complaining it hurts. It stops him from long, continuous riding. This could easily be upgraded to a nice padded seat. Second, the foam tires wear but they are a good quality so they should last a while. All in all it's a great buy but possibly another bike at a lower price point may have been just as good.
customer_reviews.author: E.K.

customer_reviews.title: Unlimited smiles, high quality product, and easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is made from high quality parts and is extremely user friendly to put together. The price is worth ever dollar for the exchange of unlimited smiles you will receive from your child’s pure joy riding his or her new bike.
customer_reviews.author: Angphoenix

customer_reviews.title: I would say the product in general seemed to be fairly sturdy and clean looking bike
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this balance bike for my son for his birthday. Assuming it would be a fairly quick assembly, I ran into an issue the night before his birthday where the clamp that connects the front wheel tube and handle bars would not fit on properly. My guess is the front wheel tube is barely out of spec as the front wheel was extremely stiff and difficult to move. Should this issue not have happened, I would say the product in general seemed to be fairly sturdy and clean looking bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Great product- well worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we expected and even better, our 16 month old daughter loves it! Her feet barely touch the ground (at the lowest setting), but she loves trying to balance on it while standing and even more so, loves being pushed around. We can’t wait until she’s a little bit taller! About the product- well made and a solid frame. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mountainfam22

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My son is in love. Super easy to put together. Great bright green color. He’s already trying to do tricks and ride up and over things 🤣 seems very sturdy as his 9 year old brother keeps playing on it also. Also my son is 2 and won’t be out growing it anytime soon, seat is in the lowest position.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stutzman

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to....
customer_reviews.text: Most people are used to learning with training wheels. I couldn't get my kid to get the hang of this and he never wanted to use it and I ended up getting another bike w/ training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Only drawback is that my grandson won't use it
customer_reviews.text: This little bike is sturdy, lightweight, and easy to store. The only trouble is that my 2 year old grandson refuses to ride it. We're hoping he'll take to it this coming Spring.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: We have had three striders and they have been awesome for our kids
customer_reviews.text: We have had three striders and they have been awesome for our kids. We bought this one for our nephew who is 2. My son started riding his at 18 months and by 2.5 years old he was good enough to hop on a pedal bike and take off unassisted. He’s now 5 and a truly awesome little mountain biker! We recommend these to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tnefaub

customer_reviews.title: Plastic wheels not rubber
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble with clear instructions. Works as described, Would have much preferred the wheels be actual rubber. The plastic wheels make it light weight and the frame of the bike is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: We love the sturdy dependability of the strider
customer_reviews.text: We love the sturdy dependability of the strider. Our 4 year old has a pedal bike, but still loves his strider so much that we had to get another for our toddler. Amazing adjustability and the newer ones (this one) has even better capability to tighten adjustable parts. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Olivus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and to use
customer_reviews.text: Did research. This one has great placement of seat, handlebars, and foot bars. 2 year old daughter loves it and requests to go bike riding. Lightweight for times when daughter is done riding, and I have to carry it. Seat is very easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: baldiman

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Bike for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son started using this around his 2nd birthday, just mostly pushing it around. He is 3 now and can ride a two wheel bike without training wheels like a champ. I credit this entirely to learning how to balance properly on this starter bike. Get this for your child, its so good for their overall stability and development of motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Del Padre

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: My 18.5 year old son loves his new bike! He's already figuring it out after only a few uses! Easy to assemble & adjust. Looking forward to seeing how he progresses! The only thing I wish it had was a kick stand for when the bike's not in use.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this balance bike for my nephew and my niece can’t grt him off of it. Very well made and easy to ride, he will lesrn to balamce in no time on this bike. Great product, i will purchase this agsin!
customer_reviews.author: hunter1015

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss for your kid's readiness.
customer_reviews.text: Your kid either is interested in learning to ride a bike this way (sitting on the seat and kicking the ground like a scooter) or not. You may be better off starting with a tricycle. We were. She may eventually be into this, but by then she'll probably be too big for this. Check the measurements and the height of child it works for.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and very adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and the perfect size for my petit 2 year old. The seat adjusts very low. We got it for my daughter’s 2nd birthday and she fits well on it but it might take her a while to get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Outsen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our now 3 year olds 2nd birthday. He loves it!! Gets used often and still looks brand new. We love this balance bike and our happy to see our little dude enjoy it so much, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Love

customer_reviews.title: Best way to learn!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this bike! This is perfect for him and he zooms past kids on peddle bikes at the park. People are always amazed to see him picking up his feet and flying down the sidewalk. All 3 of my boys have learned on balance bikes. I highly recommend strider bikes!
customer_reviews.author: AR582

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together and to adjust seat height
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together and to adjust seat height. Lightweight and durable. My daughter got it for her 2nd birthday and she loves it. She Still doesn't quite have the hang of it but we haven't had much opportunity to take it out because it's winter.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Bought to have for this weekend and it arrived and missing pieces. My son hasn't rode it yet but the seat seems hard. Easy assembly but missing pieces makes it annoying when you buy it with 2 day shipping for a special event.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe' Shaylynn

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: This think is awesome! My two year old loves it. Still getting the hang of it but instantly was able to figure it out all on her own.
customer_reviews.author: John Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap seat and tires, but otherwise, it's ok
customer_reviews.text: Meh -- it gets the job done but I'm mad at two things: (1) the seat is super uncomfortable as it's super hard plastic, (2) the tires are some sort of dense foam instead of rubber. Apparently you can buy a better seat and tires at an extra cost, but come on...
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Defective piece
customer_reviews.text: Hey! We ordered the classic Strider bike in green and seem to have a problem with the assembly. The #5 piece in the instruction manual (the part that connects the handle bars to the bike and determines the height) is defective. It’s too small to fit around the bike and against all our best efforts with pliers and other tools we cannot open the piece enough to attach properly. Bummer because I know how easy the assembly should be on these bikes!
customer_reviews.author: moultca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We love our strider. On Christmas Eve my husband and I put this together to be from Santa. It was pretty easy to put together. My husband kept making remarks about how I could of spent so much money on a bike with plastic wheels, but let me tell you.. after just one week he was eating his words. My son is so great at riding this bike. The plastic wheels make the bike so much lighter so my son can easily pick it up to go up curbs. Super adorable, and we get so many compliments! Such a great invention, and I can't wait to transition him to a pedal bike!
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: We love this bike
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike! Our son wanted to be just like his cousins riding their bikes, only he was too little to have a big one like theirs. He was only around 22 months when we purchased the bike. It has been the best investment though! He is now a little over two and is gliding along his buddies, doesn't even notice the difference in their bikes. : )
customer_reviews.author: Sracing0770

customer_reviews.title: The best starter bike out there
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction but still lightweight. Foam type tires mean you will never need to change a flat. Having taught two kids to ride training wheels and two on balance bikes I can tell you balance bikes are the way to go. My 2 year old when from never having ridden a bike to winning races within weeks. You can adjust the handlebar height and the seat height to accommodate a wide range of child size. I highly recommend a strider bike as your kids first bike. If they can walk they can strider.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: This came early which was perfect as it arrived on my granddaughters birthday. Its a lighter weight than her brother's was so easier for her to manage as she is a petite 2 y.o, It seems perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. K

customer_reviews.title: Love the color.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured. I bought this for my almost two year olds. She will sit on it for a minute, and then get off. I'm hoping she will get used to it soon. I was told by friends it may take some time. I can't wait until she rides it I've heard nothing but good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 22 month old granddaughter and she has just begun "walking" with the bike. Opted for the green, which is bright, so that it would be gender neutral for future siblings. Easy to assemble and appears to be quality constructed. She is catching on quickly. Suggested by my son who works in bike industry as a great first bike. Good purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: KSween

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the best, Strider
customer_reviews.text: Both my daughter and son have Striders. They have been using them since their first birthdays, and are now 2.5 yrs old and 4.5 yrs old. Though the 4 year old needs a taller seat ordered, he still loves his Yamaha Strider and everyone stops us to ask where we got them from. I've seen friends buy other brands and I was not impressed folks. Stick with the best, Strider!
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, as expected
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, as expected. There was a sharp burr left on one of the welds that in really glad we caught before our kiddo got slashed on it. Kinda bummed I gotta scuff the paint with a file and sandpaper. Otherwise, an awesome bike. Wish these were around when I was little
customer_reviews.author: MichiganHathNoFury

customer_reviews.title: This one doesn’t come with additional seat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike when my son was 18 months. He got on Christmas morning & ride it into the bedroom. He started racing it at 2 years old. He loved this bike! People around town were amazed by him & the bike. Great investment. Didn’t like that ours didn’t come with a second seat like mist others we talked to did.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy G.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bike for my 2 1/2 year old!! He loves it. Easy to assemble. Great bike for a great price. (He also pretends it’s a dirt bike lol)
customer_reviews.author: Vince Erika Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great bike and great price
customer_reviews.text: Great bike and great price. Our 2 1/2 y.o. is learning balance and steering without having to worry about peddling. She is slow, but with patience she is able to go on walks with this bike. We still take our double stroller, so that we can put this little bike and our little one instead of carry them. Our 5 y.o. learned on a peddle bike and seemed to have more difficulty trying to coordinate pedals, steering and balance and stayed on training wheels for a while.
customer_reviews.author: St Pat

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together! So durable. Can’t wait for my one year old to be y’all enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good little bike
customer_reviews.text: My son likes the bike but grew out of it fast Sold it and got most of my money back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steering column doesn’t fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son and the steering column doesnt fit correctly. I had to force it on and once I was able to pry the locking piece on with plyers the only way to make the bike turn is for someone much bigger than a 2 year old to turn it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product quality and time of delivery.
customer_reviews.text: My order was late which wasn't good because my son was on his only 7 days of vacation from work, with it arriving late gave him no days left to experience his son riding the bike. He works very long hours and has very little time for his family. ☹☹☹
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Szanto

customer_reviews.title: Best way to start
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of wiggle room for growth. Make sure you get the right size and start early enough. My son has gained lots of balance with this. I think this should be the way every kid should start. My son started riding with training wheels at 1 1/2 and still had issues until a few months ago. He's 4 1/2 now. Training wheels don't TEACH them.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: My son rode this for a couple years. he transitioned between this and a peddle bike with training wheels for a short while to get comfortable peddling. we took the training wheels off a few months later and he was riding no problem
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Handlebars wobbly...
customer_reviews.text: I got this and was very excited for my 2yrnold birthday. Assembly is easy. However, the handlebars are extremely wobbly...... both my Husband and I tried and we are at a loss. It shouldn’t be this difficult as the instructions are simple. We are wondering if we got a defective product... anyone else have this issue? How can we fix it...?
customer_reviews.author: Michele Christine Finley

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention!
customer_reviews.text: Second one we bought for a grand-kid. I wish they had these when our kids were little. They graduate quickly to a pedal bike. Very cute to watch the kids racing around on their Striders.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son when he was just two. By the time he was three he was riding a bike with no training wheels
customer_reviews.author: his_child

customer_reviews.title: the bike fit him just fine. It took a few weeks for him to ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son when he was about 20 months old. With the seat lowered, the bike fit him just fine. It took a few weeks for him to figure it out. Now that he's 2, he can pick it up, hop on, and walk with it on his own.
customer_reviews.author: SBK

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this bike. He caught on fast and its just over all great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah I

customer_reviews.title: Great present for toddler/preschool age children!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my daughter's second birthday. She loves it! We have had it for about 6 months now. We started with the seat at one of the lowest positions because my daughter is petite. Now she has grown a bit and we raised the seat. She has really gotten the hang of it and if gliding around the neighborhood!! I even think my 4 year old would fit on this thing just fine! It's the perfect size. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Oliver

customer_reviews.title: This is such a quality, smooth bike, but please note...
customer_reviews.text: My child will be turning three soon, and he has almost outgrown it. This bike is very small! I would say it is perfect for 18 months old through just turning 3.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Christmas

customer_reviews.title: I have seen other models now that have a better place for them to put their feet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 20 month old nephew. I have seen other models now that have a better place for them to put their feet. I wish I had bought that now, but he seems to love the bicycle. still has a lot to learn before he can actually balance on it but it won't be long.
customer_reviews.author: castlex4

customer_reviews.title: The correct way to learn to ride a bike
customer_reviews.text: Our first kid used training wheels, but after reading about these we used them to get our 2nd child started. It makes a huge difference! They learn to balance! The old style training wheels actually hinder learning. Transition from this to a "pedal bike" was very easy for my 3 year old son. I never thought a child could learn to ride so early.
customer_reviews.author: Active Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest little bike! Perfect for our 20 month old. It gives him the mobility that a trike just can't give and also teaches balance. This is our second purchase of a Strider in the past 5 years for grandkids and we are very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Catar L.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start toddlers riding
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quick delivery. My son put my grandson on the Strider when he was 1 and he has gotten so much joy out of riding this. He just turned 3 and because of the balance he learned riding the Strider he was able to learn in a couple days to ride a regular 2 wheeler bike without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: slinderman

customer_reviews.title: Best present yet
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old daughter loves this! Best present yet.
customer_reviews.author: KBear916

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this little balance bike. I gave it to him for his 2nd birthday a month ago and he can already balance perfectly! He rides it everyday and loves to be able to ride while big brother rides his bike out front. Very durable too. He throws it on the ground and it is tough.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Adams

customer_reviews.title: This bike was very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I got this strider bike for my 2 year old daughter for Christmas. The seat and handle bars are adjustable to fit each child. This bike was very easy to assemble. I originally purchased a competitors bike but when it arrived I was unable to assemble it. My daughter has only had this for a few days and is quickly picking up on how to ride! I highly recommend this Strider bike for those in the market!
customer_reviews.author: Vince S

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old has loved it over the last year
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old has loved it over the last year. Be careful because the handle bars can twist if not tight enough and it will steer crooked. A quick adjustment and tightening and all is good again. Good size and weight to pack up and take places too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tu

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the grandkids to learn how to balance and ride
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the grandkids to learn how to balance and ride
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thurman

customer_reviews.title: Great Stride r
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Strider that I have bought, this one is for Grandson number 2. My first Grandson just about wore the tires out before he moved up to a larger bike and did not need training wheel! I would highly recommend this for any small child 2 or older.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, my sons love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my toddler loves it and rides it every day. I am buying another and the rocking base for my one year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic way to learn to ride
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight and very sturdy. Both our kids have gotten started biking very young using this bike.
customer_reviews.author: N. Long

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: We received the item and wrapped it for our son for Christmas. He opened it today only to find it contained ZERO hardware parts and were unable to put together to let him play with it. I’m sure we would have been very pleased with the product but not being able to use it is crappy! Now he has to wait until we get parts from the manufacturer. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Amador

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE Strider Bikes!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our youngest child who turns two in April. We love Strider bikes! This one is actually our second. The first was a strider sport, which had some better features for a few more bucks. The bike itself is made of the exact same quality construction of our first that was purchased over 3 years ago. Any kids that visit our house are always intrigued by the strider bike. I would recommend for any child boy or girl from walking through preschool.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Luzier

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2 year old nephew who loves his three wheeled ‘bike’. When he saw the box his eyes lit up, and he hasn’t stopping riding it since...great bike
customer_reviews.author: mrobison161

customer_reviews.title: great bike for a little one to begin to learn ...
customer_reviews.text: great bike for a little one to begin to learn balance on. It is challenging for children so small to think of peddling and balancing but this give them the opportunity to really get the first skill down very well and then transition on to the next much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are epic
customer_reviews.text: My son loves watching super cross with me and when this showed up it was like a natural instinct. He threw a leg over it and was walking around saying vroooom vrooooooom instantly. i was so pumped, so very stoked on this guy, I can't wait to get him in a strider race eventully!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bike! I purchased the extended seat separately because the seat it came was only good for a couple of summers. Would have been nice if it was a bit longer to make the bike last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old son loves his bike, it’s great quality and is perfect for his size and development.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves it! And I love the color! It's a good size for an 18-month-old child. She will be 2 in a couple of months and is still learning to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lee Danvers

customer_reviews.title: Best first bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for kids to learn on. Very dirable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Blake Williams

customer_reviews.title: if you have young kids you have to buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best way to teach you kids to ride a bike, both my kids went from maybe a few weeks playing on this strait to riding a bike without training wheels. Best invention ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

product_meta.title: Strider - 12 Classic Balance Bike, Ages 18 Months to 3 Years
product_meta.description: While the industry typically uses "entry-level" as shorthand for a non-race bike, we can assert with comfort and confidence that the custom grips, saddles, and other features that set Strider's lighter, more expensive models apart from the "entry-level" 12 Classic Balance Bike probably won't be missed. The 12 Classic is designed for aspiring cyclists from 18 months to 3 years of age, providing a platform to transition from striding to coasting in order to learn the balance and handling skills necessary for eventually piloting a proper bicycle. The balance bike's sturdy frame is rounded off with flat-free tires, an adjustable seatpost, footrests for gliding, and brake mounts so that -- as the young rider's coasting skills increase -- a rear brake can be added to keep things in check.
feature_bullets: LEARN TO RIDE - The Strider 12 Classic is a great, unembellished choice for those that want to jump in the pool but aren’t quite ready to cannonball. The budget-friendly Strider 12 Classic comes equipped with our no-flat tires, which are ready to take the punishment that only mud puddles and heavy riding can dole out.
GROWS WITH YOUR CHILD - The seat and handlebar heights adjust to accommodate ages 18 months to 3 years, or a 12– 17 in. inseam.

DESIGNED FOR YOUNG KIDS - Weighing in at only 3.0 kg (6.7 lbs.), the 12 Classic push bike makes it easy for your little boy or girl to ride and stride. The built-in footrests are perfect for learning to balance and glide.

YEARS OF FUN - We know kids put things through rigorous…*ahem*…testing. With the 12 Classic’s durable steel frame and puncture-proof tires, you don't have to worry about damage or maintenance, and the adjustable seatpost and handle bars enable the bike to grow with your child.

IT’S MORE THAN JUST A RIDING TOY - In our quest to turn kids into amazing riders and awesome human beings, we made our Learn-To-Ride Guide available online when you register your child’s Strider. Become your little rebel’s biggest cheerleader with the best bike out there.
